Pre-Game Insights: Dave Roberts heading into Sunday’s bullpen game: 'We have potentially two games here, and I feel that to prevent runs, we’re in a very good spot.'
The Dodgers leverage relievers are certainly well-rested, after Roberts wasn’t as urgent to relieve Jack Flaherty before Game 5 got away.
The Mets’ backs are against the wall, but have a starter in Sean Manaea who did well against the Dodgers in Game 2, especially his first two times through the order.
Post-Match Reflections: 'We have potentially two games here, and I feel that to prevent runs, we’re in a very good spot,' Roberts said, reflecting on his nine years of managing in the postseason.
'I don’t think we’ve exposed our high-leverage guys at all. And that’s part of kind of the learning curve for me over history.'
